title: Why can we get champion shards if we have every champion?
body: I just don't think that it makes sense to let people who have no use for champion shards get champion shards. Unless I'm completely missing something...

replies.body:
They intend to give a use for them eventually, they just haven't decided what exactly.

(You can also reroll them when new champs come out to get the new champ for sure, but that's probably needless in most cases since those with all champs probably also have tons of spare IP.)

It's like opening a pack of collectable cards and complaining about getting one you already have.

The chests are random.  Champion shards are in the chests.  Don't complain.

> [{quoted}](name=redniwediS,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tKqwHW1q,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-03-29T22:27:57.053+0000)
>
> It's like opening a pack of collectable cards and complaining about getting one you already have.

It's really not. It's more like opening a pack of collectible cards and complaining about getting a card from a different set you own entirely.
There's only one set.  You can't get one from another set.

> [{quoted}](name=redniwediS,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=tKqwHW1q,comment-id=000100000001,timestamp=2016-03-29T23:03:19.348+0000)
>
> There's only one set.  You can't get one from another set.

Think of it like this: there are two sets in one pack that are entirely separate from each other (champion and cosmetic). 

What **is ** happening is the two sets are currently inseparable and can't be transferred/traded over into the other set which is kind of unfair if you consider how many more cosmetic items there are in the game than champions (684 non-default skins opposed to 130 champions, and the worth of the skins is most definitely over 2x the worth of the champions AND also not obtainable through IP). 

What **should **be happening is (at least regarding the RP hextech chests) chests should be giving you cosmetic shards only if you have all your champions because it's a little unfair to let people who've worked hard enough to own every champion to be put on the same playing field as others in terms of champion ownership.

**Not to mention, using collectible cards (trading cards) is kind of a lazy example considering their purpose is to be traded.**

Champions are commons, skins are uncommons, and gems are rares...

Except you only get one per pack!
So outrageous that I haven't seen one yet ):
